thread.title: Honolulu- San Francisco emergency declared on United Airlines
thread.title_full: Honolulu- San Francisco emergency declared on United Airlines

author: eTN Managing Editor
title: Honolulu- San Francisco emergency declared on United Airlines
text:
THE LIST: 5 Star Rated by eTN Readers - and not for sale! Hotels - Airlines - CVBs - Destinations - people Honolulu- San Francisco emergency declared on United Airlines Adv: 
Jul 07, 2015 Adv: 
Hawaii is the most remote place on earth, and the 5 to 6 hour flight from Honolulu to San Francisco is the longest overwater flight and the shortest flight between Honolulu and the Mainland USA. 
On Monday night United Airlines flight 396 took off at gate 8 from Honolulu International Airport at 9.08 pm and landed again in Honolulu at 11.02pm and the airline cancelled the almost full flight 
The United Captain noticed after more than an hour into the flight smoke coming from one of the two engines and declared an emergency. He was guided back to Honolulu and able to land the aircraft safely. 
Emergency vehicles and maintenance vehicles were chasing to the runway and after observing the failed engine no visible damage or smoke was seen. 
The aircraft was towed to gate 8, passengers were able to leave the aircraft and will be accommodated tomorrow.
